page.title: 03E.Horsley S. Open Space
page.content: Sheepleas is an area of land owned by Surrey County Council & designated an Open Space & Country Park. There is a good variety of trees, mainly beech, some of which are very old. Acer, Sycamore, Ash, Pine, Rowan, Oak & Holly were seen, also two distinct avenues of yew which must have been planted but it is not clear why. One area may have been part of a garden, as various shrubs were growing,privet, weigelia, box, cupressus & dogwood. Squirrels & rabbits were seen, also damage done by gnawing at tree bark. There were many thrushes & blackbirds & a large badgers' sett. We listed 33 varieties of wild flowers blooming in in July. Rarest is the orchid which is at its best then. In one meadow the purple spotted orchid was very prolific & we saw several deeper pur- ple Pyramidar & Twayblade orchids.
